channel.title: DFC Featured Content
channel.description: The latest developer content featured on the DFC home page -- new technical articles, sample code, developer stories, and more.

item.title: Code: Google Data APIs Schema Demo
item.description: This open source tool extracts Force.com object meta-data and saves it to a Google Spreadsheet.

item.title: Webinar: Force.com Toolkit for Google Data APIs
item.description: A chance to watch the recent webinar, which introduces the toolkit and demonstrates the API in action.

item.title: Code: Consolidated Case History Timeline with Visualforce
item.description: Learn how to build apps that directly access the Google Documents, Calendar, Spreadsheets, Blogger and Contacts APIs as first-class Apex citizens.

item.title: Force.com Migration Tool Guide
item.description: Learn how to Deploy Apex Code and Migrate Organization Settings Using the Force.com Migration Tool, a Java/Ant-based command-line utility.

item.title: Guide to Certification
item.description: Developers and Admins will soon be able to gain official certification on the Force.com platform, with the announcement of a global rollout of formal certification.

item.title: Success Story: Bringing Force.com to Europe
item.description: Dan Belwood of Sofia Works describes his company's approach to cloud computing and its leveraging of Apex and Visualforce to build custom applications.

item.title: Summer '08 Developer Preview Release of Force.com IDE
item.description: A new version of the Force.com IDE is now available, featuring page layouts, validation rules, workflows and more.

item.title: Success Story: The Making of a Platform ISV
item.description: Scott Hemmeter looks at Force.com and sees an ISV business in the making. Read about Scott and his successful Arrowpointe Maps application.

item.title: Force.com Toolkit for Google Data APIs
item.description: This toolkit exposes the Google Data APIs directly within Apex, making it easier to access them natively from your Force.com apps. Click through to download the toolkit and access the tutorials.

item.title: Workbench 2.0 Now Available
item.description: Workbench is a community-contributed, web-based application tool that administrators and developers can use to manage salesforce.com organizations. It now includes SOSL Search, Smart Lookups and Performance Enhancements.

item.title: Success Story: Building a Career with PHP and Force.com
item.description: Discover how Mike Simonds, a developer.force.com community member, learned how to use PHP and the Force.com Web Services API to write a series of useful tools and tutorials.

item.title: Free Event: Tour de Force comes to Santa Clara, Dublin and Tokyo
item.description: Our global roadshow rolls on, with three cities in June: Santa Clara, Dublin and Tokyo. Whether you're a developer, IT pro, business analyst, or entrepreneur, come and meet the community and Force.com experts, and benefit from tutorials, technical sessions, hands-on labs and demos. All for free. Reserve your spot today!

item.title: Webinar: Beyond S-Controls. Master Visualforce in Summer '08
item.description: With the imminent release of Visualforce, your days of relying on S-Controls should be numbered. Register for this live webinar and learn why replacing them with Visualforce will reward you with speed, stability, and much more

item.title: MyLoanBiz Builds Mortgage Application on the Force.com Platform
item.description: The five-person MyLoanBiz company, which calls on a small pool of developers on an as-needed basis, runs a tight shop that maximizes the strengths of each employee. Read their story on how the Force.com platform has given the company a blueprint for building a business - complete with technology, marketing, and new releases.

item.title: CODA Launches First Enterprise Accounting System Built on the Force.com Platform
item.description: CODA just launched CODA 2go, an on-demand financial system built entirely on the Force.com platform. Learn how they developed their custom application in this success story.

item.title: Enhancing Print Anything To Allow Direct PDF Generation
item.description: Enhancing the Print Anything project, Astitch.net recently published a free extension called the Astitch Document Generator. Find out how this application allows direct PDF generation by exposing the power of XSL and the FOP (Formatting Objects Processing) standard to any data in Salesforce.

item.title: Ready to Deploy Visualforce? It's Coming in Summer '08!
item.description: Dreamforce Europe opened today with the announcement that Visualforce and Visualforce Components will be made available with the Summer '08 release, out early June. Get started by following our tutorials, demos, code samples and more.

item.title: S-Controls and AJAX: Show a Pull-Down List of Related Contacts
item.description: This S-Control example uses AJAX and JavaScript to add functionality to a standard page. Download the sample code and learn how to supplement your pages with additional information while maintaining a familiar user interface.

item.title: Download the Workbench App & Open Source Code
item.description: Combining the power of both the Apex Data Loader with the Force.com Explorer, the Workbench can insert, upsert, update, export, delete, undelete, and purge data as well as describe any object in your salesforce.com organization. The Web app, along with as the source code are now available for you to download.

item.title: Developing with Force.com and Google
item.description: Get started building powerful Force.com apps that integrate innovative Google technologies.

item.title: Riskonnect Delivers with Force.com
item.description: Read how the Force.com platform enabled Bob Morrell, CEO of Riskonnect, to avoid having to build and maintain his own infrastructure while delivering a revolutionary risk management solution in the process.

item.title: “The Perfect Job”: Building Force.com Apps for Nonprofits
item.description: The road to a dream job does not always run straight. Read about how Steve Andersen, who joined the tech-savvy Seattle nonprofit ONE/Northwest three years ago and has since helped build Force.com applications for some 20 Pacific Northwest environmental groups.

item.title: Discover the Advance Capabilities of Visualforce
item.description: In this article series, read how you can use Visualforce pages and controllers to create dependent picklists based on related objects, as well as creating flexible user interfaces based on these picklists.

item.title: Be a Part of the Tour de Force Experience: Atlanta, Chicago, New York, and Boston
item.description: Register now, as this global roadshow rolls on to four new cities in April! Atlanta, Chicago, New York, and Boston are the next stops on our 20-city tour. Whether you're a developer, IT pro, business analyst, or entrepreneur, this is the ideal opportunity to experience Force.com live and in person. Come and meet the community and the top Force.com experts and benefit from tutorials, technical sessions, hands-on labs, and demos. Reserve your spot today!

item.title: Force.com Platform Offers Path to Profit in Ten Months
item.description: How does a small startup attract customers like Hitachi, Symantec, and CBS and within one year turn a profit? The way Apttus puts it, quite easily. Read this to learn how Apttus built its first application — and startup success -- entirely on the Force.com platform.

item.title: Force.com Email Services: Sample code for how to unsubscribe from emails
item.description: Would you like to have a way to allow your customers and prospects to unsubscribe email messages sent out by marketing companies? Learn from this sample code how you can write Force.com Email Services to process unsubscribe requests from the email recipients. Download Now!

item.title: Announcing the Latest Version of the PHP Toolkit
item.description:
Looking for an easy way to make Web service API method calls? The new version of the PHP Toolkit is for you. And if you’re already a toolkit user, you’ll be delighted to know that it’s been updated for the latest API, including support for the new metadata API.
Download Now!

item.title: Force.com Email Services
item.description: Learn how you can use Force.com Email Services to send emails to Salesforce and process them with Apex code to create and update data from inbound emails. This sample code shows you how an email can be used to create new tasks for a contact record with a matching email address.

item.title: Announcing Force.com Development as a Service
item.description: Discover the new set of tools and services that bring developer productivity and collaboration to the Force.com platform-as-a-service model. Development as a Service includes the new Metadata API, Force.com IDE and more.

item.title: Who’s Using Force.com?
item.description: Read about customers and developers that are finding fast, cost-effective success building their latest business apps on the force.com platform.

item.title: Tour de Force San Francisco – A Force.com Platform Conference
item.description: Kick off the New Year with Tour de Force San Francisco! Join us for this powerful free event and the chance to learn new skills, get expert guidance, and hear inside information on the latest Force.com development technologies.

item.title: Whitepaper: The Force.com Platform
item.description: Force.com platform, the world’s leading on-demand development and deployment environment. The Force.com platform brings all the advantages of the on-demand environment to your own custom applications. Get an introduction to the basics of the platform, including its architecture and main components.

item.title: Tutorial: Force.com for ASP.NET Developers
item.description: Learn how you can use Force.com Web Services to access Salesforce.com data from within a Visualforce page and/or a Microsoft ASP.NET Web form. This article will take you through the process of creating custom Force.com logic, then demonstrate how to call that logic from within a Force.com application or from a custom application hosted outside Salesforce.com. Go ahead and mash it up!

item.title: Force.com: Apex Email Services
item.description: The Apex Email Services preview is now available in your Developer Edition Org., and should be generally available in the next major release. This feature allows you to create email addresses which can process Apex code as seen in this sample code.

item.title: Force.com Enables Motorola Admin to Expand Role, Responsibilities
item.description: Michael Farrington has become a force to be reckoned with, thanks to Force.com. Read how Farrington, a Salesforce Administrator on the Sales Technology Team at Motorola’s Enterprise Mobility unit, taught himself how to build Force.com apps, then created a Force.com solution to vastly streamlined a key process for his company.

item.title: Tell Us What You’re Building with Force.com
item.description: We’re eager to hear about the cool new apps you are building with Visualforce and force.com! Submit a qualified Visualforce story and we’ll send you a one of our new Force.com t-shirts (while supplies last).

item.title: Enterprise Integration Series: Force.com Data Loader
item.description: Integrating Force.com applications with your existing environment sometimes requires moving data in and out of the Force.com database. This screencast, part of the Enterprise Integration Series, focuses on the Force.com Data Loader, covering functionality, tips for effective use, and a demo.

item.title: Introducing Force.com Ideas
item.description: We're excited to introduce Force.com Ideas, a set of IdeaExchange categories for the Force.com community. Get active in shaping the platform by posting, commenting, and voting on Force.com ideas. Now the community has a unified way to voice its needs, and we are listening!

item.title: Using Browser Technologies in Visualforce
item.description: Questions about using various browsers technologies and how they fit into the Visualforce strategy? Read this four-part series and get answers on how Visualforce, Flex, and Ajax all work together on the Force.com platform.

item.title: Success with Visualforce Developer Preview: Employee Directory Application
item.description: Jason Ouellette of Appirio, is one of the 3000 Visualforce Developer Preview program participant taking advantage of the new technology. Read about his experience building a demo Employee Directory application.

item.title: "From Admin to App Builder" Live Webinar
item.description: Want to build powerful applications without programming, to support any process or department in your company? Then join us for a live webinar on how to use Force.com to create custom apps that take advantage of the platform's latest features, including workflow, rollup summary fields, and formulas.

item.title: PDF Your Force.com Data with Print Anything and Google Docs
item.description: Want to create PDF of your Force.com data? Follow this step-by-step guide and learn how to create Adobe PDF files using Print Anything and Google Docs.

item.title: Force.com Tutorial: An Introduction to Visualforce
item.description: Force.com Tutorial: An Introduction to Visualforce Get step-by-step guidance on building your first Visualforce page from this very practical, hands-on tutorial. It covers everything from getting access to the Visualforce Dev Preview to seeing your first Visualforce page live.

item.title: Get Your Hands on Visualforce Preview
item.description: Enable your Developer Edition org today and start building on-demand apps that utilize the complete force.com "platform as a service" stack.

item.title: Winter '08 Developer Preview Program
item.description: Welcome to the Winter '08 Preview for Developers. Get the latest information on what's new and hot for developers in the Winter '08 release, including some key coders-only technologies you can get your hands on through this Developer Preview.

item.title: Developers@Dreamforce ‘07 Sessions Now Available Online!
item.description: Missed Dreamforce ‘07? Everyone from entrepreneurs to admins to hard-core developers can now watch over 30 Developers@Dreamforce sessions across four tracks. These practical presentations and demos from Force.com technical experts give you essential fundamentals, insider tips and tricks, and development best practices on the latest Force.com technologies.

item.title: A Dreamforce Attendee Builds a BlackBerry App with Visualforce
item.description: ADN member and Dreamforce ‘07 attendee, Elaine, wasted no time getting started with the Visualforce Developer Preview. Read about the Visualforce tips and tricks she discovered while hanging out in the Developer Lounge and building a custom user experience for her BlackBerry 8800.

item.title: Building a Blogging Application Using Visualforce
item.description: You truly can build almost anything on the Force.com platform! This short sample walks you through the creation of a simple blogging app, showing several interesting uses of Visualforce, including a rich text widget from Yahoo, “on load” events in the page, custom controller, “on click” and “action complete” handlers.

item.title: Webinar: Platform-as-a-Service and the Future of Enterprise Architecture
item.description: Attend Dave Linthicum's latest webinar for free and to find out why enterprise architecture is evolving from complex, monolithic infrastructures to something far more efficient and dynamic: Platform-as-a-Service.

item.title: Announcing Visualforce
item.description: The latest addition to the force.com platform, Visualforce provides a complete framework for building and deploying any kind of user experience, and enabling any kind of interface design and interaction to be built and delivered entirely on demand.

item.title: Apex Code: The World’s First On-Demand Programming Language
item.description: This whitepaper provides a conceptual overview of Apex Code and its capabilities, as well as the opportunities it opens for developers.

item.title: Send Emails Through S-Controls
item.description: Build new functionality with the Spring '07 Email API. This code example allows you to send emails through the new Email API. You can send both Mass and Single Emails, CC and BCC email addresses, include your email signature as well as send text or HTML email.

item.title: Apex Day '07
item.description: ADN Members who missed the event can log in and watch the videos of the presentations and demos. Not a member? It's easy and free to join.

item.title: Building Offline Salesforce Apps with Google Gears
item.description: How can your users stay productive with your Salesforce web app while on a plane? You now use Google Gears and Google Web Toolkit to make any on-demand application work off line as well. Read all about it in this article and download the sample code to get started.

item.title: Java Partner WSDL Samples 10.0
item.description: Learn how to use the Apex API 10.0 with the Partner WSDL with Java. This sample is a great place to start since it contains an Ant build script, necessary library, and code samples that exercise all the available API method calls.

item.title: Apex Toolkit for Eclipse
item.description: Download the new version of the Apex Toolkit for Eclipse. Find out why this is an ideal tool for writing Apex Code and s-controls as well as publishing finished Apex code into other Salesforce instances.

item.title: Ready to Launch your On-Demand Company?
item.description: Join hundreds of successful companies who have built their businesses on the salesforce.com platform. Take advantage of a complete set of startup tools, resources and services to build your business today!

item.title: Salesforce Platform Success on the Subcontinent
item.description: Read about the amazing success Indian developers are finding on the Salesforce Platform and AppExchange. These partners have recognized the opportunity of on-demand, and are quickly capitalizing on it to grow their businesses.

item.title: Get Ready: Dreamforce Developer Preview Screencast
item.description: Developers@Dreamforce '07 will feature some of the biggest Salesforce.com technology announcements ever. Watch this screencast to get a sneak preview demonstrations of exciting new on-demand technologies such as Apex Code(GA), Metadata API (preview), and more. Also, learn how you can receive early access in order to start working with them right away.

item.title: Configuring and Implementing Single Sign-on for Salesforce.com
item.description: Learn how to configure the Salesforce environment for Single Sign-On, as described in the How to Implementing Single Sign On with Salesforce.com>guide. In addition, implement client-based Single Sign-On by finding out how token-based SSO can be accomplished with Salesforce desktop clients such as Outlook Edition, Lotus Notes Edition, and Office Edition.

item.title: Summer '07 Developer Preview
item.description: Find the latest information on what's new and hot for developers in the Summer '07. Take a preview of Apex Code, Salesforce SOA, Metadata API, and more!

item.title: Mashup Third Party Web Services with AJAX Proxy
item.description: Using this tutorial/sample code, learn how to build a mashup on the Salesforce platform using data from a third party web service. As an example, this web service takes in two country names and returns the exchange rate for those two countries.

item.title: Introducing the Salesforce Enterprise Integration Series
item.description: The Salesforce Platform makes the concepts of SOA real, and this multipart series will show you how. In this first installment, get an overview and learn about system landscapes, platform integration capabilities, and how you can successfully integrate with Salesforce.com.

item.title: Build On-Demand Apps with Adobe Flex
item.description: Were you not able to attend the webinar? You can now watch the screencast and hear from top technical experts from both Salesforce.com and Adobe, and learn how quick and easy it is to create rich applications on the salesforce.com platform with the Flex Toolkit for Apex.

item.title: Apex Data Loader 9.0
item.description: Learn how to use the Apex Data Loader to perform bulk operations on your Salesforce.com org -- insert, update, upsert and delete data, as well as export data from Salesforce objects.

item.title: Salesforce Developer Conference Wrapup
item.description: There's nothing like attending a Salesforce event in person, but this page is the next best thing. Watch the keynotes, review the sessions, and find out what you missed.

item.title: Announcing Developers @ Dreamforce '07
item.description: Dreamforce '07 will have more for developers than ever! Five tracks on everything from Apex Code, app development basics, and advanced programming, to building your on-demand business. Plus, powerful labs, special events, parties, and more.

item.title: Building a Google Calendar Mash-up with Salesforce SOA
item.description: You can combine the power of the Salesforce platform with Google Apps to create secure enterprise mash-ups! Read this to see how to use Salesforce SOA and Google Data APIs to present an integrated view of calendar information.

item.title: Apollo for Apex Sample Code
item.description: Spur your imagination on what you can do with Flex/Apollo and the Flex Toolkit for Apex. This sample code is a desktop widget for displaying tasks and events from your salesforce.com account on your desktop.

item.title: Power of Salesforce SOA in Action
item.description: Watch this 10 min screencast demo and learn how this powerful new capability of the Apex programming language will enable on-demand developers to leverage Web services from anywhere.

item.title: Announcing Salesforce SOA
item.description: Introducing Salesforce SOA, a powerful new capability of the Apex programming language that enables developers to leverage Web services from anywhere and build them into their on-demand applications. Salesforce SOA makes it possible to mashup salesforce.com's multi-tenant on-demand service with enterprise workflow and business processes to enable new kinds of enterprise applications on demand.

item.title: Free Book Download: Start Building Your First On-Demand App Today
item.description: Read this new second edition of the "Creating On-Demand Applications" book and start building on-demand applications. Newly revised and expanded, it provides practical, step-by-step coverage of the Apex platform and how you can use it to build your own business solutions in hours.

item.title: Salesforce Upsert Tutorial
item.description: Read this tutorial by Mike Simonds, an active member of the ADN community. The tutorial focuses on using Oracle as a local database and pushing data to salesforce.com. Learn how performing updates/inserts to salesforce.com via the upsert command gives an organization much more flexibility to keep data refreshed from an internal data system and the organizations sforce instance.

item.title: Best Practice Guide for Style Sheets and S-Controls
item.description: Read this simple, How-To Guide for the "not-so-advanced" S-Control developer who wants to apply the Salesforce.com branding to their S-Controls in six easy steps!

item.title: On-Demand Platforms and the Future of Enterprise Architecture
item.description: Download Dave Linthicum's latest whitepaper for free and discover the benefits of using an on-demand model for enterprise architecture.

item.title: Coding With Apex: Salesforce Toolmaker's Batch Product Goes Real-time
item.description: Read the developer success story on Glenn Wilson of Toronto's CRMfusion. Apex Code is still in preview, Glenn has already put it to work—creating a prototype application that's well on its way to becoming a product and ready to ship as soon as Apex Code is released.

item.title: Tutorial: Creating Flex Salesforce Mashups
item.description: Learn how to use the new a to create a simple Flex application and embed this within your Salesforce application.

item.title: Mashups: The What and Why
item.description: The first in a two-part series, this article provides an intro to core mashup concepts, as well as covers techniques for creating and enabling enterprise mashups.

item.title: Learn to Develop On-Demand Business Applications
item.description: Watch the screencast and discover how the Apex platform makes it easy to create sophisticated applications with complex business logic—and scale them to thousands of users—without servers or infrastructure. The session was presented by Adam Gross of salesforce.com, as well our partners Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) and Engizma Software from India.

item.title: ADN@Web 2.0 Expo
item.description: Visit us at Web 2.0 Expo! We'll be speaking on the business web and demoing the latest Apex platform technologies, including something entirely new for Apex developers.

item.title: Time Off Manager: Application Demo
item.description: Get tips on real-world implementation of key Apex platform features andtechnologies by watching this demo of a new app built on Apex.

item.title: ADN Insider Briefing: Spring '07 Screencast
item.description: Watch this practical developer update presented by Dave Carroll, ADNTechnical Evangelist and Andrew Waite, PM Apex Code. Log-in required.

item.title: Spring '07 Release Updates for Developers
item.description: Get updates on the Spring '07 release.

item.title: What's New in Apex Web Services API Spring '07
item.description: With the release of Spring '07, including the Apex API, read about the new features and bug fixes that improve the capabilities of applications that leverage the Apex platform.

item.title: Developing on the Apex Platform
item.description: Watch this technical session from the recent Apex Day event for an overview of core platform features and technologies.

item.title: Apex Code Developer Preview Program
item.description: Find out how ADN members can get access to the Apex Code Developer Preview through their Developer Edition accounts.

item.title: Building a FLEX S-Control Mash-Up
item.description: AJAX plus Adobe Flex makes for a rich visual interface, and this article tells the story of a mashup that takes advantage of those technologies to chart the opportunity stages at an account.

item.title: What's New in Apex Web Services API Winter '07
item.description: Comprehensive review of new features, changes and bug fixes in the Winter 07 (8.0) release of the Apex API.
